logica_jogo

Class EditorProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • logica_jogo.EditorProcessor

  • public class EditorProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that parses and processes the information coming from the editor and creates a new Tabuleiro instance based on the parsed information

    • Method Detail

      • getPositions

        private static Coordinate[] getPositions(char[][] lab)
        A function that returns an array of Coordinate objects containing the positions of the various elements inside a given maze.Null is returned if an error occurs and the errorCode data member is set.
        Parameters:
        lab - A char two dimensional array that is supposed to be parsed.
        Returns:
        An array of Coordinate objects containing the positions of the various elements inside the maze. The first element is the position of the hero. The second element is the position of the Sword. The following ones (if there are any) are the various Dragons' positions.

      • getNrOfDragons

        private static int getNrOfDragons(char[][] theLab)
        A method that return the number of Dragons inside a given maze.
        Parameters:
        theLab - The maze to be parsed.
        Returns:
        The number of dragons inside a given maze

      • getCleanedLab

        private static char[][] getCleanedLab()

      • generateInitializedTab

        public static Tabuleiro generateInitializedTab(char[][] labToParse)
        A method that generates an Initialized Tabuleiro with the contents of a given maze. null is returned if an error occurs and the errorCode data member is set. This value can be used to check for errors during the execution of this method.
        Parameters:
        labToParse - The maze to be parsed.
        Returns:
        An object of type Tabuleiro initialized with the contents of a given maze.

      • updateLabWithExit

        private static void updateLabWithExit()
        This method creates an exit on the maze currently being processed. errorCode variable is set if an error occurs.

      • getErrorCode

        public static EditorProcessor.ErrorCode getErrorCode()

      • getDragons

        private static Dragon[] getDragons(int len,
                  Coordinate[] coords)
        Parameters:
        len - The number of dragons present in the maze
        coords - An array containing the positions of the various elements in the maze. The first two elements refer to the Hero and Sword. The following (if any) are the positions of dragons.
        Returns:
        An array with the Dragons initialized
